alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will impact portions of southeastern Worcester, southern Norfolk, western Barnstable, Plymouth, Bristol, northern Kent, Providence and northern Bristol Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thompson to 6 miles northeast of Plymouth. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, New Bedford, Brockton, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Plymouth, Taunton, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, Franklin, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, Milford, and Stoughton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Bristol; Eastern Kent; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Western Kent
